column1: Third - send supplies! Political organizing in the midst of COVID is no small feat. Vols and staff need PPE and bad-weather gear to make sure they can safely talk to voters and mobilize our coalition. Read the @NewGAProject wishlist here and chip in.   https://t.co/YHNTHkdt8j

Tonight at 8pm.  @laurenkennedyma @rboyntonjarrett and I will be on Facebook Live talking about our kids school in the COVID-19 era equity and education justice.  Join us. https://t.co/cGwx4SqMSA https://t.co/AO8VAOkiTr

COVID-19 made it clear:   Your health my health our kids’ health — they are all connected.   That’s why we fight to ensure that every single American has health coverage.   That’s why we need Medicare for All.

18 days. 18 Election Days.   18 chances to go out and meet people where they are. To listen. To learn. To confront the challenges in front of us — from COVID-19 to racial injustice to an economy that has abandoned working families. https://t.co/OK05pzCoyR

The common thread between the election of Trump the wreckage of COVID-19 and the protests against injustice in our streets is a government that has not listened to its people. We need leadership who lives here and stays connected to the people who call our Commonwealth home. https://t.co/6CdhqBSHH5

The common thread between the election of Donald Trump the wreckage of COVID-19 and the protests against injustice in our streets is a government that has not listened to its people. https://t.co/79wn2BHFOR

The common thread between the election of Donald Trump the wreckage of COVID-19 and the protests against injustice in our streets is a government that has not listened to its people. https://t.co/Sy4pxNx1pQ
Over 500000 people in this country go homeless every night.   Our economy was broken long before Donald Trump and long before COVID-19. Rebuilding it will be the work of a generation.

Across Massachusetts community health centers have been on the frontlines of this pandemic. In Great Barrington they are providing essential protection to all those in need.   Proud to have led the fight in Congress to expand CHC funding in our COVID response efforts. https://t.co/QG5eK0fvVB

Went block walking with @RepChynahTyler. Talking with folks on their stoops in Tommy’s Rock to the BHA Senior Apartments in Roxbury. We have to bring everyone into the conversation to build a better post-COVID America. https://t.co/FggBIOBBbv

Our country is in crisis. The old ways aren’t working. We need new leaders to fix the damage Trump has done to rebuild after COVID-19 and undo generations of inequity and injustice. That’s why I’m running.  30 days until September 1. Let's keep fighting. https://t.co/ixBX8d1jFv

Our country is in crisis. The old ways aren’t working. We need new leaders to take on Trump to rebuild after COVID-19 and undo generations of inequity and injustice. That’s why I’m running. Join us: https://t.co/7zwvI9aujq

Rather than protecting our people this President is refusing additional funding for testing centers as we have become the epicenter of COVID-19 cases worldwide.  It’s reckless. It’s dangerous. And it’s a failure to the health of our people — and the world.

Continuing our Jobs and Justice Tour in every corner of the state from North Adams to New Bedford to Quincy.   We need to bring everyone into this process so we can rebuild a stronger and more resilient post-COVID economy — together.  https://t.co/7b1KvhlYaI

Stop two of our second day on the Jobs and Justice Initiative tour.   The Four Star Farm in Northfield has shifted their production to thrive in a pre- and post-COVID economy and to stand up to big agriculture. Grateful for their input into our plan as we move forward. https://t.co/bnoNQDeI9b

The Jobs and Justice Initiative proposes:  A large-scale public works and federal hiring program designed to both address the acute needs of COVID-19 response and to remedy the profound injustices of our modern economy which long predated this pandemic.

COVID-19 helped expose the deep injustice of our modern economy. Recovering and rebuilding from this moment will be the work of a generation. We have the opportunity to tear down what was badly broken and build something better fairer and stronger in its place.

The Kennedy Jobs and Justice Initiative is my plan for building a just equal and resilient post-COVID economy.  In the weeks to come I’ll be traveling across MA to listen and receive input on the plan. As your Senator you will have a seat at the table while developing policy. https://t.co/4Km55r47Bv

COVID exposed the deep injustice of our modern economy.   Recovering and rebuilding from this moment will be the work of a generation. We have the opportunity to tear down what was badly broken and build something better fairer and stronger in its place. https://t.co/IVLpg4W0dv

Building a just equal and resilient post-COVID economy will be the work of a generation.  Today I released the Kennedy Jobs & Justice Initiative.  Now I'll be crossing the state to get feedback from the people of MA.   As your Senator I won't legislate without you at the table. https://t.co/EgqnuekjD0

Looking forward to joining a conversation with the Brazilian Women's Group about immigration racial justice COVID-19 economic recovery and voting in 2020. Join us at 8:30  https://t.co/A13b0LG8at https://t.co/0pamqAN7f6

I was asked: What do you say to people who were barred from attending a loved one’s funeral because of COVID-19 but then see politicians support mass gatherings at protests?   Here’s what I said. https://t.co/w9msi8nPDg

Our country is in a moment of crisis. Innocent Black and Brown lives being taken in our streets. Over 100000 lives lost to COVID-19 and 40 million out of work.  Tonight we debate how we are going to help build something better for our future. https://t.co/mvNkmDQ7OF https://t.co/zB6sB9KVNR
|The fight for reproductive health care during COVID-19 || Joined by OB-GYN’s from across Massachusetts https://t.co/YxalaQx8nW|
|Impact of COVID-19 on prisons and incarcerated individuals || Joined by @LynnNovick Director of @CBB_PBS and @JLeequon https://t.co/ZhV3bBzpfP|
When the COVID-19 vaccine is developed it should free and available to all.
We need a response to COVID-19 that matches the scope of the pain we’re all feeling — and we need an Administration and Senate capable of understanding that.

More people have died in this country from COVID-19 than all of Vietnam.  Yet Mitch McConnell is saying “We have not yet felt the urgency of acting immediately.”  How many deaths it will take for him to feel the urgency to act? https://t.co/3iOz62D5N8
Mi conversación con @jorgeramosnews y @CollinsOficial sobre el impacto del COVID19 en nuestro país. https://t.co/lpIkCt20hW
|How to talk to our kids about COVID-19 || Why school is closed why playdates aren’t happening and why we wear masks outside. https://t.co/3R4cjoZVH5|

Tune in at 8pm for a discussion with @SaruJayaraman of @OneFairWage on the impact of COVID-19 on the service industry — and why it’s far past time tipped workers are paid a fair wage. https://t.co/CvyJEtA3pW

If there’s a lesson to take from COVID-19 it’s that your health and my health are directly linked.   We need to recognize our common humanity and recognize our right to health care. That’s why we must continue fighting for Medicare For All. https://t.co/qmVtgWbdIT
|Impact of Covid-19 on Nursing Homes || Joined by Jodi Ouimette Administrator at Williamstown Commons Nursing and Rehabilitation Center  https://t.co/wlCBAeRjjy|
|Impact of Covid-19 on Nursing Homes || Joined by Jodi Jodi Ouimette Administrator at Williamstown Commons Nursing and Rehabilitation Center https://t.co/FebkffgpQL|
Childcare is not an economic accessory — it is a necessity.   Let that be one of the lessons this country never forgets in the wake of COVID-19.

Decades long injustices have caused an even harsher impact of COVID-19 on communites of color immigrant and low income communities.  Join @RevDrBarber and I tonight for a conversation at 8pm ET. https://t.co/U7pWXIn2uk
|Managing mental health during COVID-19 || Joined by the composers and cast of @DearEvanHansen https://t.co/Hv9K5koVOE|

On Earth Day we need to renew the fight for climate and environmental justice. We are seeing the decades-long failure to protect our most vulnerable communities play out today with COVID-19.  We need to fix these issues at their source. Starting with these two bills: https://t.co/lw7dVFNwyG
We need a seismic shift in how we treat workers. That should have happened long before this crisis. But now COVID-19 gives us no excuse.

While the president is peddling untested drugs as a treatment to COVID-19 those who need hydroxychloroquine to survive are facing shortages.   It’s dangerous. And putting more lives at risk.   Thank you @morethanmySLE  for shedding light on this.  https://t.co/3Hf0kZuZMK
“It frightens me that this administration sees this as a perfect storm for voter suppression.”   — @JasonKander on the combination of COVID-19 and the lack of vote by mail  https://t.co/CdjNjjpOPz
|The crushing impact of COVID-19 on communities of color is rooted in systemic structural failures || Joined by @andreperryedu https://t.co/qtRvfrBBAa|

COVID-19 creates profound challenges for ballot access. As the legislature considers reducing barriers for candidates they should work to reduce barriers for voters too.   We need a vote-by-mail plan for all of Massachusetts.
Noticias sobre COVID-19: las autoridades de inmigración no pueden penalizarlo por buscar ayuda y tratamiento para COVID-19 https://t.co/sTDusbuAyg

Two things:  1. Testing for COVID is free. If you feel sick. Call a doctor.  2. You cannot be penalized by immigration authorities for seeking help and treatment for COVID.   Spread the word. https://t.co/m2FtuMpxgw

We all like to say disease does not discriminate. But it does.  In a deeply unjust health care system COVID-19 is hyper targeted at communities of color low income communities and those working on the frontlines.  Let’s acknowledge it. Address it. Act. And save lives.

In Chelsea there are 96 COVID-19 cases per 10k residents.   Next highest in Massachusetts is 60 cases per 10k. All of which are disproportionally communities of color.   We need real action to fix this — to provide relief.  https://t.co/pFit5uhKVM
|Joined by Chelsea MA leaders addressing how COVID-19 has disproportionately impacted their community.   |||||| Emergency Kennedy Broadcast https://t.co/FwninfJj7S|
|Communities of color have been ravaged disproportionally by COVID-19 || Emergency Frontline Broadcast https://t.co/PDEv4A6pFI|

Chelsea has been hit disproportionately hard by COVID-19.  At noon we will be airing a live broadcast with local leaders to discuss how racial disparities have left families in Chelsea underserved under-protected and asking for our help. https://t.co/QuJ8XKZKkY

Finally the horrifying news. COVID-19 was said to be the great equalizer— it didn’t matter who you were you could get sick. While that’s true the data actually says the virus is NOT affecting our America equally.

Harvard just released a study directly linking concentrated air pollution and COVID-19 mortality.  Just as it’s become clear that frontline environmental justice communities like Chelsea are hardest hit by this virus.  None of this is a coincidence. Injustice compounds injustice.

This virus is exposing the disparities inequities and injustice in American health care.  We need racial and ethnic data on COVID-19 patients now.  I’m asking MA to set a national standard and release that information. We won’t solve this crisis without it.

Testing for COVID-19 is free but treatment isn’t.   And this administration had the chance to enact a special enrollment period to help more people get critical coverage.   But they didn’t. And they won’t.   Meanwhile 100000 or more are going to die. https://t.co/oU7xUqBQ98

Over 100 healthcare professionals in MA have contracted COVID-19.  In part because of the lack of urgency from this president.  Some even resorted to wearing garbage bags as PPE.  We need supplies. We need masks. Our frontlines are suffering.  Suggesting otherwise is disgusting. https://t.co/5nX4gkFwcH
Wanted to give everyone a quick update on the bill going through congress to combat COVID-19 (The CARES Act). https://t.co/yq673BfsOF
Quiero informarles sobre la respuesta del congreso para combatir el COVID-19 (The CARES Act) https://t.co/AIYOfImvJb
What can you do to fight coronavirus? #StayHome save lives. Joined by Andy Slavitt tonight. https://t.co/185fqresSX
COVID-19 Virtual Town Hall with Jason Furman https://t.co/fOWgwH7Rpr
COVID-19 Virtual Town Hall https://t.co/qo9sczMFYb

In the face of COVID-19 we are temporarily suspending all campaign activity. Our sole focus will be the health + safety of this community and the general public. We will keep our digital platforms open and active to help share critical resources in the days ahead.
All COVID-19 testing AND treatment must be free and available for every single American.

What we need and what we’re fighting for right now:  – Free and accessible COVID-19 testing – National paid sick leave – Coverage of all COVID-19 health care related costs for the uninsured and underinsured – Moral leadership in the White House

At this moment we cannot leave anyone behind. Especially those most vulnerable.  The Trump administration must cover all COVID-19 related health care costs for people who are uninsured or underinsured.

This administration's botched handling of the COVID-19 threat their lies their misinformation and lack of urgency isn't making this any better.  Congress can't stop their scattershot response. But we can step up and provide some clarity certainty and relief.

With one of the largest online platforms in politics the president has neglected to provide consistent and factual information from the CDC about COVID-19.  Instead he’s chosen to use his platform lift up lies about the virus from right-wing platforms… and this: https://t.co/g0YvxdmB5Z

COVID-19 has exposed our ill-preparedness for public health crises reinforcing the deep and dangerous inequities that define our health care today.  As we prepare to confront this pandemic it is that inequity that could hamper our response most of all.https://t.co/rqOfCAwWON

In primetime tonight Fox Business claimed COVID-2019 was “another attempt to impeach the President.”  Meanwhile Fox News referred to the outbreak as the “Chinese Coronavirus.”  We’re in crisis and the best they’ve got is bigotry and lies.

Crisis always exposes our system’s inadequacies and inequities. As concern grows about the coronavirus this heart-wrenching story shows why staying home isn’t an option for too many. https://t.co/oUsDlmfkjr
Take the time to prepare your family and loved ones. Stay vigilant. Follow the protocols in place to be safe amid the growing cases of #COVID2019 here in Massachusetts.

The president is currently visiting a CDC laboratory on official duties while wearing a ‘Keep America Great’ campaign hat.  We need clarity and moral authority at a time of deep concern over the coronavirus. Not a political sideshow. https://t.co/AIRC1D8GYQ
With Coronavirus identified in Rhode Island we must stay vigilant Massachusetts.   Please follow the CDC’s guidelines here for prevention treatment and to learn more: https://t.co/HEfWMEufVy

Shifting funding away from essential programs like addiction relief in order to combat the coronavirus is not the answer.   If this administration was able to ‘find’ funding for billionaire tax cuts we should be able to provide funds to combat this threat.

One takeaway from the coronavirus briefing:  If there is one thing a country needs in times of potential crisis– it is clarity.   The kind of leadership we saw on display today from the Trump Administration was an embarrassment.

“This might be bad” is an egregious statement from an admin who has gutted spending to our public health institutions.  Meanwhile they are sending mixed signals about the severity of the coronavirus.  We need leadership and a plan to prevent mass outbreak and fear – not this.
